content:
Frank Wanye is a second year computer science PhD student at Virginia Tech. He is a a graduate research assistant at the Synergy Lab, led by Dr. Wu Feng. His research interests include parallel and distributed computing, graph processing, and big data. His current research project involves optimizing and parallelizing an algorithm for graph clustering for giant datasets.
Outside of research, Frank enjoys reading, sports, video games, art, and learning to play the keyboard.

title: Frank Wanye

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math.
summary: We evaluate the extent to which existing sampling methods preserve community structure in graphs, and show that they can be used to significantly speed up the stochastic block partitioning algorithm.
title: Fast stochastic block partitioning via sampling
